Corporate Controller role with large, Billion dollar annual revenue company. Ideal industry is large distribution, healthcare, or Manufacturing. Salary is high six figures Base + Bonus. This position manages a team of 15 and is based in Phoenix, AZ. For immediate consideration, please email me at wspengler@teemagroup.com or call my cell phone at 410-913-7236.
I just had 3 offers turned down in the last week. Rough week right? Sure, not winning stinks, but this is a recruiters job:

Wake up everyday to provide the best opportunities we can to our candidates, find the top notch candidates for our teams, walk them both through the process, prep them, listen to them, advise them.......and at the end of the day, you can't win them all but you CAN walk away knowing you did the best job that you could, you used all of the tools in your toolbox, and YOU change peoples lives. Whether they choose your team or not, you still were an outstanding advisor, and by god, you're going to stay that way.

TEEMA Solutions Group Inc. (TEEMA) has become one of the fastest growing Staffing Solutions company in North America.   Our focus is delivering full-cycle staffing solutions, whether that is short term, contract or long term, permanent. We love our clients and we support them by placing quality people in the right position at the right time.  TEEMA is governed by rock solid values, a mandate to empower our members and a commitment to excellence. Our Members are the most tenured in the staffing industry, with deep and wide networks of talented resources. We are passionate about what we do. Our clients have access to a wealth of experience unsurpassed in staffing. We believe the future is about ‘disrupting our industry‘ and our rapid growth is evident of that (cited by Profit 50, Red Herring, INC 5000 and Branham 300).   Come join the revolution.   Visit our company page: TEEMA on LinkedIn

Samuel HR specializes in executive medical recruiting for hospitals and medical clinics nationwide. Director of Recruiting overseeing operations and supervision of 25 employees.	[May 2012 – Nov 2014]•	Managed entire operation on behalf of an absentee owner, hiring and training healthcare recruiters, reviewing contracts and requisitions, sourcing executive talent (physicians and hospital CEOs) and matching qualified candidates with client needs.•	Hired, coached, trained and managed recruiting staff, resolved employee differences, and encouraged an atmosphere of professionalism; leading to higher commissions and improved morale.•	Introduced a step-by-step training program that empowered recruiters to complete their first hire within 2 weeks, rather than the previous model of 3-4 months.•	Worked with recruiters in helping to surpass metrics and attain goals.•	Increased client fee schedule by 125% without affecting the ability to bring in new business.•	Grew annual revenues by 2500% (from 6 to 8 figures) during tenure and expanded staff from 8 to 25.Recruiter	[Sep 2011 – May 2012]•	Launched career with zero clients, established relationships, sourced executive candidates, and negotiated contracts and salaries.•	Generated 250% more in fees than the average new hire.•	Managed both clients and candidates in a full-desk.

The Elks Lodge is a private club with 6,000 square feet of meeting space for special events.Lodge Director managing daily operations and a staff of 5 bartenders and 2 janitors.•	Negotiated event contracts, paid bills, maintained inventory, processed customer payments and employee payroll, hired and scheduled event staff.•	Grew revenues and bookings significantly, from 2 main events annually to approximately 3 per month through customer referrals, guest experiences, and advertising in local wedding magazines. •	Achieved annual savings on liquor costs by more than 25% with volume purchases and enforcing pour rules behind the bar.•	Transformed losses into profits by re-evaluating contracts and adding customary charges.•	Secured a fraternal organization gambling license and consistently passed state audits.

Tradeshow Manager charged with on-site management of a 30x20 foot booth at 24 major conventions.•	Traveled to tradeshows throughout the country, coordinated logistics of booth pieces and marketing materials; managed staff throughout the show, booked lodging, and reserved rental cars.  •	Helped set up (and later tear down) an elaborate booth display over a 3-day period. •	Selected gifts and advertising pieces to hand out to booth visitors.

The Evergreen Center for the Arts is a unique gallery and gathering place for artists of all skill levels and disciplines to display and sell their works, and learn from others through workshops. Director of Exhibitions and Marketing	•	Created and distributed all marketing materials, including press releases which resulted in free publicity every month in the calendar section of the Denver Post and Rocky Mountain News.•	Orchestrated Summerfest and Winterfest, two prestigious festivals showcasing works by talented artists, attracting 5,000 people, and generating about $100,000 in revenue for each event. •	Coordinated more than 100 volunteers for the entire operation to assist with incoming calls, direct mail, and gallery sales and inquiries.•	Changed out the gallery every month with new exhibits, coordinating removal of previous month’s works and installation of new pieces. •	Contracted with artists and reserved space for classroom instruction. •	Raised $10K by creating and administering 100 for $100, getting 100 artists to donate a piece of artwork for auction.•	Conceived a 6-week long event for artists to Paint, Sculpt and Shoot at the venues, which became the largest fundraiser event for the center..•	Hired musicians and purchased fruit, cheese, and wine for the Friday Art Walk.
